content: the fluffy vest katr_crochet by introduction the fluffy vest is a simple and lightweight crochet vest perfect for any occasion with beginners in mind the vest is made to measure and primarily utilizes the single crochet stitch you will need light-weight mohair yarn i used diablo from hobbii for the sample vest the reference vest a size s requires approximately 4 skeins of 50g each use two strands simultaneously a size 6 mm crochet hook scissors stitch markers measuring tape *us terms abbreviations st = stitch slip_stitch = slip_stitch chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet decrease = decrease increase = increase st marker = stitch marker fphdc = front post half_double_crochet bphdc = back post half_double_crochet note if you re not familiar with all the terms youtube can be a good resource for guidance and clarification ps the pattern hasn t undergone testing so if you come across any errors or have uncertainties your feedback would be greatly valued 1 instructions front panel determine the width of your vest by taking your bust measurement and dividing it in half if you prefer a more oversized look feel free to add additional centimeters to this measurement to begin create a slip knot on your hook using two strands of yarn chain a length that matches the width measurement calculated above ensure the chain is pretty loose to maintain a straight appearance for the vest row 1 single_crochet 1 into the second stitch from the hook and then single_crochet 1 into each chain space until you reach the end of the row chain 1 turn row 2 single_crochet 1 into the first stitch and continue with 1 single_crochet into every stitch until the end of the row chain 1 turn row 3-x repeat row 2 until you achieve a square that reaches the desired length from your armpits down towards your hips do not fasten_off note remember to crochet very loosely to create a lighter appearance shaping the armpits to shape the armpits you will make decreases in the upcoming row in the example vest decreases were made at the beginning and end of the next 6 row but you can adjust the number based on your body shape and size start reducing by single_crochet 1 into the second st of the previous row and single_crochet 1 into each st until you reach the second to last st of the row skip the second st and single_crochet 1 into the last st of the row chain 1 turn repeat this process for as many row as needed to shape your armpit keep in mind to decrease at both the start and end of each row 2 chest after the decreases you want to make the chest-part which is made in the same way as the waist/beginning part - meaning only straight row single_crochet into the first st single_crochet to the end of the row chain 1 and turn repeat this until you reach your clavicle don t fasten_off remember to leave space
